intro: Vincetoxicum edule, commonly known as edible false bindweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its climbing habit and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow fruits that contain seeds, and it has opposite, simple leaves with a slightly hairy texture. Vincetoxicum edule is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides, and it can be invasive in some regions. Botanically, it is notable for its milky sap and its historical use in traditional medicine.
